text: Winter Welcome Week for new students
Gorlok Gala Speech and Debate Tournament

Founded in 1878, Southwest Baptist University is a private Christian college with                         campuses in Bolivar, Springfield, Salem and Mountain View, Missouri. Our mission is                         to equip students academically, spiritually and socially for a lifetime of servant                         leadership.
Integration of Science and Christian Faith
Southwest Baptist University is a private Christian college recognized for its excellence                      in Christian higher education, scholarships and affordability, and superior curriculum.
One of America's Best Christian Colleges each year since 1997
One of America's 100 Best College Buys each year since 1996
"A" rating on general education curriculum (American Council of Trustees and Alumni)                         — one of just 25 institutions nationwide
Named one of the nation's Best Private Colleges for Minimizing Student Debt (LendEDU)
SBU Athletics inducts Class of 2020 into Hall of Fame

Southwest Baptist University Athletics inducted the Class of 2020 into its Hall of Fame during ceremonies in conjunction with the men's and women's basketball doubleheader with the University of Missouri-St. Louis on Saturday, Jan. 11.
SBU-Mountain View hosting Open House for students on Jan. 15
The Southwest Baptist University-Mountain View campus will be hosting an Open House on Wednesday, Jan. 15 in the Myrtle Glass Building on the Mountain View campus.

Apply now to join the SBU Bearcats family — the application fee is currently waived                      so you can apply for
Choose your campus and student type

Use the options below to select the SBU campus you wish to attend and the type of                                  student you will be (undergraduate or graduate). You can then view your admissions                                  requirements and begin your online application.
Submit official transcript from an accredited or approved high school or homeschool
Meet two of the following three qualifiers:
2.50  high school cumulative GPA on a 4.00 scale
Rank in the top 50% of high school class
Submit official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities
You must have a transfer GPA of 2.00 or higher to be admitted. If your GPA is lower                                     than a 2.00, your application will be considered by the admissions committee.
, who is here to help you through each step of the process!

on general education curriculum by the American Council of Trustees and Alumni —
one of just 24 institutions nationwide to earn this rating and the only school in                         Missouri!
